initial_story:
Firefighters and police were seen outside the office of Mike Freer MP

Police are investigating a suspected arson attack at the office of North London Conservative MP Mike Freer.

A fire broke out at the rear of the North Finchley and Golders Green MP's constituency office at around 19:00 on Christmas Eve.

The Met Police confirmed it is investigating the fire.

Mr Freer told the BBC the fire happened at the rear of the premises and no one was in the building at the time of the incident.

He continued: "The police and fire brigade were on the scene in minutes and have been incredible in their response."

London Fire Brigade (LFB) confirmed the fire started in a shed outside the office before spreading to the rest of the building.

An LFB spokesperson said: "An external shed was destroyed by fire. Part of the first, second and third floors of the property were also damaged by the blaze."

In a statement, a Metropolitan Police spokesperson said: "The cause of the fire is under investigation as it is believed it may have been started deliberately. There have been no arrests."

Pictures posted on social media showed Metropolitan Police and LFB vehicles at the premises on Sunday evening.

Mr Freer has represented the North London constituency since 2010.

He is parliamentary under-secretary of state for courts and legal services, a junior role in the Ministry of Justice.

Pictures show the fire spread to an office inside the building

Suddenly, I heard a rustling in the bushes behind me and turned around to see a massive wolf with glowing red eyes staring straight at me. I froze in terror, unable to move. The wolf lunged at me, its razor-sharp teeth glinting in the moonlight. I tried to dodge its attack, but it was too late. The wolf sunk its teeth into my shoulder, ripping through my flesh and bone like it was nothing. I screamed in pain as blood gushed from my wound.

Just before I lost consciousness, I heard a deep, guttural voice in my head: "You have been chosen to become the next alpha of our pack. Embrace your newfound power and lead us to victory." With that, the wolf transformed into a man and stood over me, offering me his hand. I took it, and together we ran through the forest, our pack at our heels, ready to take on any challenge that came our way.

As we ran, I felt a surge of energy coursing through my veins. My senses became sharper, my reflexes quicker. I could hear every sound in the forest, smell every scent, and see every detail in the darkness. The man next to me transformed into a wolf, and together we led the pack through the forest, hunting prey and claiming territory. I felt a sense of power and purpose I had never experienced before.

We ran for hours, until we reached the edge of the forest and emerged into a vast, open plain. In the distance, we saw a group of hunters on horseback, armed with rifles and spears. They spotted us and began to chase us across the plain. We were outnumbered, but we didn't back down. We fought back, using our superior speed and strength to take down the hunters one by one.

The battle was fierce, but in the end, we emerged victorious. We had claimed the territory as our own, and the hunters had been taught a lesson they would never forget. As the sun rose over the horizon, I felt a sense of pride and accomplishment like never before. I was the new alpha of the pack, and I was ready to lead my pack to even greater victories in the future.

But then, something unexpected happened. I began to feel a strange sensation in my body. It started with a slight tingling in my fingers and toes, but quickly spread throughout my entire body. My skin began to feel hot and itchy, and I felt a sudden urge to shed my human form.

I tried to resist the urge, but it was too strong. I fell to the ground and began to convulse, my body transforming into that of a massive wolf. I howled in pain and rage as my bones cracked and snapped, my muscles bulging and twisting. When the transformation was complete, I stood up and looked around at my pack. They were all staring at me in awe and reverence.

I realized then that I had fully embraced my role as the new alpha of the pack. I had become a true wolf, with all the strength and power that came with it. I led my pack out onto the plain, ready to take on any challenge that came our way.

We roamed the land, hunting prey and claiming territory, always on the lookout for any signs of danger. We were a force to be reckoned with, and we knew it.

But then, one day, we sensed a threat unlike anything we had ever encountered before. It was a pack of hyenas, fierce and cunning, and they had their sights set on our territory.

We prepared for battle, but the hyenas were relentless. They attacked from all sides, biting and clawing at our pack members. But we fought back with all our strength, refusing to back down.

The battle raged on for hours, until finally, we emerged victorious. The hyenas had been defeated, but the cost had been high. Many of our pack members had been injured, and some had even lost their lives.

As the alpha, I felt a deep sense of responsibility for the well-being of my pack. I knew that we had to find a way to protect ourselves from future threats.

And that's when I had an idea. I gathered my pack members together and told them about my plan.

"We must build a fortress," I said. "A place where we can hide and protect ourselves from danger."

The pack members looked at me with confusion and doubt. But I persisted, explaining that we could use our combined strength and skills to create a structure that would be impenetrable to any enemy.

And so we set to work, gathering materials from the land around us and using our paws and teeth to shape them into a formidable fortress.

It took weeks of hard work, but finally, we had created a structure that we could all be proud of. It was a towering fortress with thick walls and sharp spikes, a place where we could rest and protect ourselves from any threat.

But even as we celebrated our victory, we knew that there would always be new challenges to face. As the alpha, it was my responsibility to lead my pack through whatever came our way.

And so we continued our journey, always on the lookout for danger and always ready to fight for our survival.

But then, one day, we came across something that we had never seen before. It was a group of humans, dressed in strange clothing and carrying strange weapons. They had set up camp in our territory and were hunting our prey.

We were stunned by their presence. We had never encountered humans before, and we had no idea what they wanted from us.

But then, one of the humans approached us. He was tall and muscular, with a stern look in his eyes.

"I am the leader of this group," he said. "We are here to hunt and gather food, and we mean you no harm."

I looked at my pack members, unsure of what to do. We were wary of these strange creatures, but we also knew that we couldn't fight them alone.

"What do you want from us?" I asked.

The human leader looked at me for a moment, as if considering his words carefully.

"We want to live in peace," he said. "We will not harm you or your pack, as long as you do not harm us. We can help each other, if you let us."

I looked at the human leader, and I saw something in his eyes that I had never seen before. It was a sense of understanding, of compassion. I realized then that we could not fight this group of humans, but we could try to coexist with them.

And so we made a deal. The humans would share their food and supplies with us, and in return, we would protect them from any danger that came our way.

It was a strange arrangement, but it worked. We lived in harmony with the humans, sharing our territory and our resources. We hunted together, and we protected each other from any threats that came our way.

And in the end, we all learned a valuable lesson. We learned that even though we were different species, we could still coexist and work together towards a common goal.

And so we continued our journey, always on the lookout for danger, but also always ready to help those in need. We had become more than just a pack of wolves. We had become a force for good in the world.
